itemDescription: English botanist, botanical and scientific illustrator (1845-1927)

wikipedia_page.main:
Mary Anne Stebbing FLS (née Saunders; 11 September 1845 – 21 January 1927) was a botanist and botanical illustrator.  She was the daughter of botanist and entomologist William Wilson Saunders and wife of zoologist Thomas Roscoe Rede Stebbing.Many of Stebbing's illustrations were destroyed in an 1881 house fire, but some surviving illustrations are held at the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew.She was among the first women to be admitted to the Linnean Society. 
She died on 21 January 1927 in Tunbridge Wells and was buried in Rusthall.
